name: PRIMED Phenotype Data Model
description: Data model for phenotype data in the PRIMED consortium

columns.description: subject identifier used by dbGaP (if available)
short name for study as defined by CC
flag if subject has been submitted to dbGaP

columns.notes: overlap with omop-person

columns.description: a concept or classification scheme that categorizes people into groups (or “populations”) according to a perceived characteristic or dimension of interest
columns.notes: delimited list (delim is '|'). race and ethnicity info are in the omop-person table

columns.description: name given to a population that describes or classifies it according to the dimension along which it was identified
columns.notes: delimited list same length as population_descriptor (delim is '|')
AnVIL requires entity id with naming convention <table_name>_id

columns.description: absolute file path in cloud storage
Number of unique subjects in file
Number of rows in file (may be > n_subjects for longitudinal data)

columns.notes: AnVIL requires entity id with naming convention <table_name>_id

columns.description: md5 checksum for the file in file_path
absolute file path in cloud storage
Number of unique subjects in file
Number of rows in file (may be > n_subjects for longitudinal data)

columns.notes: references subject_id in subject table

columns.description: the age at which the observation or measurement for the phenotype of interest was taken
indicator of visit number since participant/patient enrollment
indicator of prevalent or incident coronary heart disease event
columns.notes: includes self-report and adjudicated
references subject_id in subject table

columns.description: the age at which the observation or measurement for the phenotype(s) were taken
indicator of visit or time of observation

columns.description: Cardiovascular diseases (CVD)  Note: CVD includes coronary artery disease (CAD) OR coronary heart disease (CHD) OR myocardial infarction (MI) OR stroke (CVA, acute ischemic stroke, or acute hemorrhagic stroke), based on available data in each cohort.

columns.description: whether or not the participant had breast cancer
columns.notes: 0 = 'no' 1 = 'yes' Missing values can either be left blank or set to NA.

columns.description: age at which participant was diagnosed with breast cancer
columns.notes: may be the same as age_at_obs or not
Missing values can be left blank or set to NA

columns.description: staging per diagnosis or biopsy. Note that this refers to T stage measuring tumor size.
staging per diagnosis or biopsy. Note that this refers to T stage measuring tumor size.
staging per diagnosis or biopsy. Note that this refers to the general T stage and should be used if numeric T stage is not available.
columns.notes: numeric stage is preferred, if available. missing values can either be left blank or set to NA

whether or not participant received surgery

columns.description: whether or not participant received hormone therapy. Includes oopherectomy, hysterectomy
columns.notes: Indicate hormone therapy type in the analyst comments
0 = 'no' 1 = 'yes' Missing values can either be left blank or set to NA.

columns.description: age at which natural menopause occurred
columns.notes: NA if menopause has not occurred

columns.description: whether or not hormone use occurred post menopause (not cancer-related use)
columns.notes: 0 = 'no' 1 = 'yes' Missing values can either be left blank or set to NA.

columns.description: the number of pregnancies carried for at least 20 weeks
age at which the first birth occurred
indication of whether individual is deceased
columns.notes: 0 = 'no' 1 = 'yes' Missing values can either be left blank or set to NA.

columns.description: indication of whether cause of death was due to breast cancer or other cause
columns.notes: 0 = 'no, cause of death not due to breast cancer' 1 = 'yes, cause of death due to breast cancer' Missing values indicate unknown cause of death not deceased and can either be left blank or set to NA.
Set to missing (either blank or NA) if individual is not deceased
